alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:19AM EST until January 31 at 11:17AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Twiggs, Monroe, Bibb, Jones and Houston Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20 feet, Minor flooding expands. An increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be around one foot deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under one to three feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 18 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
